unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: smart meter rollout gains momentum across India

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide smart meter deployment program is gaining traction, with significant progress reported across several states. Power Grid Corporation of India (PGCIL) is playing a pivotal role in infrastructure development, facilitating seamless data transmission from smart meters to DISCOM control centers.
normalised: New Delhi – The nationwide smart meter deployment program is gaining traction, with significant progress reported across several states. Power Grid Corporation of India (P G C I L) is playing a pivotal role in infrastructure development, facilitating seamless data transmission from smart meters to D I S C O M control centers.

unnormalised: Uttar Pradesh DISCOMs are on track to install 2.5 million smart meters by December 31st, 2024, aiming to reduce Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses. In Tamil Nadu, TANGEDCO is piloting smart meter implementation in Chennai, evaluating consumer response before a broader rollout. Early data from the pilot suggests a potential reduction in energy consumption of up to 15% for some households.
normalised: Uttar Pradesh D I S C O M s are on track to install two point five million smart meters by December thirty first, two thousand and twenty four, aiming to reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses. In Tamil Nadu, T A N G E D C O is piloting smart meter implementation in Chennai, evaluating consumer response before a broader rollout. Early data from the pilot suggests a potential reduction in energy consumption of up to fifteen percent for some households.

unnormalised: The initiative aligns with the Government of India's vision of 'Power for All' and aims to enhance grid efficiency and reliability. Concerns about data privacy are being addressed through robust security protocols. Consumer awareness campaigns are scheduled for implementation starting at 10:00 hrs on 10/11/2023 to educate citizens about the benefits and functionalities of smart meters. The deadline for the next progress review is 17/11/2023. This nationwide program will revolutionize how India consumes and manages power in the 21st century.
normalised: The initiative aligns with the Government of India's vision of 'Power for All' and aims to enhance grid efficiency and reliability. Concerns about data privacy are being addressed through robust security protocols. Consumer awareness campaigns are scheduled for implementation starting at ten zero zero hours on tenth November two thousand and twenty three to educate citizens about the benefits and functionalities of smart meters. The deadline for the next progress review is seventeenth November two thousand and twenty three. This nationwide program will revolutionize how India consumes and manages power in the twenty first century.
